metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16944 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The receive_msg function in receive.c in the SMTP daemon in Exim 4.88 and 4.89 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop and stack exhaustion) via vectors involving BDAT commands and an improper check for a '.' character signifying the end of the content, related to the bdat_getc function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16944` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
exim4-base - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
exim4-config - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
exim4-daemon-light - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
eximon4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> only affects Exim 4.88 or newer

criterions.comment: exim4 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2').
